intro: Adenia linearis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf adenia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are often fragrant and attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Adenia linearis is well adapted to sandy soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
